channel.title: Hosted Private Cloud Status - Incident History

item.title: [Global][Dedicated Cloud] - End of Life Dedicated Cloud
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 19, 10:00 UTC  -  Dec 20, 10:00 UTC

Jul 25, 13:27 UTC
Scheduled - End of Life Dedicated Cloud: 30 September 2022
We informed you in October 2021 that our Dedicad Cloud service will reach its end of life and will be discontinued the 30st September 2022. This step is important for your VMware platforms to improve the quality of service, performance, and security of your clusters. Indeed, "Dedicated Cloud" hardware used, pre-2016, does not allow us to provide the best level of service and integration with new modern architectures of VMware.
Following our previous email, many customers started to plan and/or to migrate and we encourage you to do the same to avoid the September deadline.

Guide to migrating to a new infrastructure:
https://docs.ovh.com/gb/en/private-cloud/vdc-migration/

item.title: [LIM1C][VMware Private Cloud] - vCenter upgrade
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 19, 07:00 UTC  -  Dec 23, 18:00 UTC

Nov 28, 21:54 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 19/12/2022 07:00 UTC 
End time : 23/12/2022 18:00 UTC 
Service impact : The management plane will be unavailable for 3 hours. 
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, we are rolling an upgrade for the VMware vCenter Server Appliance solution.

item.title: [WAW1][Infrastructure] - Rows W03 W04
item.description:
Nov 18, 16:03 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 18/11/2022 08:44 UTC
End Time : 18/11/2022 13:30 UTC
Root cause : https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/lb0dnf79rjv3
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Nov 18, 12:30 UTC
Monitoring - All impacted services are operational.
Our technical teams are checking all services that were impacted.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

Nov 18, 10:12 UTC
Update - Our technical teams are hands on the issue.
Further investigations by our teams indicate a return to service from 12:00 UTC.

Nov 18, 09:57 UTC
Update - W03A range is now up and operationnal.
Racks on W04B are still down except W04B13 - W04B14 - W04B15
Racks currently unavailable : W04B01 / W04B02 / W04B03 / W04B04 / W04B05 / W04B06 / W04B07 / W04B08 / W04B09

Nov 18, 09:30 UTC
Identified - The first investigations indicate a shutdown of the equipment due to a defect in the cooling system.
Our technical teams indicate a return to service from 14:00 UTC and are looking to reduce this delay.
We apologize for the inconvenience caused.

Nov 18, 09:12 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 18/11/2022 08:44 UTC
Service impact : Servers in the rows W03 and W04 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.

item.title: [Can][Hosted Private Cloud] - Automation/Operations
item.description:
Nov 11, 20:28 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 11/11/2022 15:14 UTC
End time : 11/11/2022 20:00 UTC
Service status: The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : The operations and automations are back online after a thorough investigation of the management plane of our network gear.

Nov 11, 19:48 UTC
Update - We are currently looking at our backend network infrastructure.

Nov 11, 19:22 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 11/11/2022 15:14 UTC
Service impact : Any operations by a customer for a OVH Private Cloud product won't be functional.
The customer access to his system via vSphere is not affected
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.
